formulas.title: Some Basic Concepts of Chemistry
formulas.subject: Physical Chemistry
formulas.description: Fundamental relationships between moles, mass, molar mass, number of particles, and volume. Essential for stoichiometric calculations and chemical equations.

formulas.title: Structure of Atom
formulas.subject: Physical Chemistry
formulas.description: Planck's quantum theory and de Broglie wavelength. Fundamental equations for understanding atomic structure, quantum numbers, and electronic configuration.

formulas.title: State of Matter
formulas.subject: Physical Chemistry
formulas.description: Ideal gas equation and Van der Waals equation for real gases. Critical for understanding gas behavior, kinetic theory, and phase transitions.

formulas.title: Thermodynamics
formulas.subject: Physical Chemistry
formulas.formula: $\Delta U = q + w$ and $\Delta H = \Delta U + \Delta(PV)$
formulas.description: First law of thermodynamics and enthalpy relationships. Foundation for understanding energy changes in chemical reactions and spontaneity.

formulas.title: Redox Reaction
formulas.subject: Physical Chemistry
formulas.description: Balancing redox reactions using oxidation number method and half-reaction method. Essential for electrochemistry and chemical reactions.

formulas.title: Chemical Equilibrium
formulas.subject: Physical Chemistry
formulas.description: Equilibrium constant expressions and relationship between Kp and Kc. Le Chatelier's principle applications and equilibrium calculations.

formulas.title: Ionic Equilibrium
formulas.subject: Physical Chemistry
formulas.description: pH, pOH calculations, buffer solutions, and common ion effect. Salt hydrolysis, solubility equilibrium, and acid-base theories.

formulas.title: Units and Dimension
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Dimensional analysis for checking equation correctness and deriving relationships. SI units, conversions, and dimensional formulas.

formulas.title: Mathematical Tools
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Calculus basics, differential equations, and mathematical techniques used in physics problem-solving. Differentiation and integration applications.

formulas.title: Vectors
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Vector addition, subtraction, dot product, cross product, and resolution of vectors. Essential foundation for all physics topics.

formulas.title: Motion in a Straight Line
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Equations of motion for uniform acceleration. Average velocity, instantaneous velocity, acceleration concepts, and motion graphs.

formulas.title: Motion in a Plane
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Projectile motion, range, maximum height, and time of flight. Relative velocity in two dimensions and circular motion basics.

formulas.title: Laws of Motion
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Newton's three laws of motion. Force, mass, acceleration relationships. Free body diagrams, constraint equations, and system dynamics.

formulas.title: Circular Motion
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Centripetal acceleration and force. Angular velocity, banking of roads, vertical circular motion, and conical pendulum.

formulas.title: Work, Energy and Power
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Work-energy theorem, conservation of mechanical energy. Kinetic and potential energy. Power, efficiency, and conservative forces.

formulas.title: Centre of Mass & System of Particles
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Center of mass calculations, momentum conservation, collisions (elastic and inelastic), variable mass systems, and rocket propulsion.

formulas.title: Rotational Motion
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Torque, moment of inertia, angular momentum. Rotational dynamics, parallel and perpendicular axis theorems, rolling motion.

formulas.title: Oscillations
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Simple harmonic motion, time period, frequency. Spring-mass system, simple pendulum, energy in SHM, and damped oscillations.

formulas.title: Thermal Properties of Matter
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Specific heat, latent heat, thermal expansion. Heat transfer: conduction, convection, and radiation. Temperature scales and calorimetry.

formulas.title: Mechanical Properties of Solids
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Young's modulus, bulk modulus, shear modulus. Hooke's law, elastic potential energy, and stress-strain relationship.

formulas.title: Mechanical Properties of Fluids
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Pascal's law, Archimedes principle, Bernoulli's equation. Viscosity, surface tension, capillarity, and fluid flow.

formulas.title: Thermodynamics
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Laws of thermodynamics, heat engines, refrigerators. Carnot cycle, entropy, isothermal and adiabatic processes.

formulas.title: Waves
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Wave equation, superposition, interference, beats. Standing waves, Doppler effect, and wave properties.

formulas.title: Gravitation
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Newton's law of gravitation, gravitational potential and field. Orbital velocity, escape velocity, Kepler's laws, and satellite motion.

formulas.title: Errors and Measurements
formulas.subject: Physics
formulas.description: Types of errors, significant figures, error propagation. Least count, accuracy, precision, and systematic vs random errors.

formulas.title: Classification of Elements and Periodicity
formulas.subject: Inorganic Chemistry
formulas.formula: $\text{Periodic Trends: IE, EA, EN, Atomic Radius}$
formulas.description: Modern periodic law, periodic trends in physical and chemical properties. Groups, periods, and classification of elements.

formulas.title: Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structure
formulas.subject: Inorganic Chemistry
formulas.description: Ionic, covalent, and coordinate bonding. VSEPR theory, hybridization, molecular orbital theory, and bond parameters.

formulas.title: P-block Elements (Group 13 and 14)
formulas.subject: Inorganic Chemistry
formulas.description: Properties of boron, aluminum, carbon, silicon families. Allotropes, compounds, reactions, and inert pair effect.

formulas.title: S-block Element
formulas.subject: Inorganic Chemistry
formulas.description: Properties of alkali metals (Group 1) and alkaline earth metals (Group 2). Compounds, reactions, and their uses.

formulas.title: Hydrogen and its Compound
formulas.subject: Inorganic Chemistry
formulas.description: Properties of hydrogen, isotopes, preparation methods. Hydrides classification, water properties, and hydrogen peroxide.

formulas.title: Basic Mathematics
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Algebraic identities, factorization, quadratic equations basics. Foundation for higher mathematics and problem-solving.

formulas.title: Sets
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Set operations, Venn diagrams, union, intersection, complement. Subset, power set, and De Morgan's laws.

formulas.title: Trigonometric Functions
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Trigonometric ratios, identities, graphs. Sine, cosine, tangent functions, compound angles, and their properties.

formulas.title: Trigonometric Equation
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: General solutions of trigonometric equations. Principal and general values, solving trigonometric equations.

formulas.title: Quadratic Equations
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Solution to quadratic equations, discriminant, nature of roots. Sum and product of roots, forming equations.

formulas.title: Sequence and Series
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Arithmetic and geometric progressions. Sum formulas, nth term, AM, GM, HM, and special series.

formulas.title: Relation Function
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Types of relations and functions. Domain, range, codomain. One-one, onto, bijective functions and composition.

formulas.title: Permutations and Combinations
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Fundamental principle of counting, permutations, combinations. Arrangements, selections, and circular permutations.

formulas.title: Binomial Theorem
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Binomial expansion for positive integral index. General term, middle term, binomial coefficients, and properties.

formulas.title: Straight Lines
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Slope, different forms of line equations. Distance formulas, angle between lines, and perpendicular distance.

formulas.title: Circles
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Standard and general equation of circle. Tangent, normal, chord properties, and family of circles.

formulas.title: Conic Sections: Parabola
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Standard equations of parabola, focus, directrix, latus rectum. Tangent, normal, and parametric equations.

formulas.title: Conic Sections: Ellipse
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Standard equations of ellipse, foci, eccentricity. Major and minor axes, tangent, normal properties.

formulas.title: Conic Sections: Hyperbola
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Standard equations of hyperbola, foci, asymptotes. Transverse and conjugate axes, eccentricity properties.

formulas.title: Complex Number
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Algebra of complex numbers, modulus, argument. Polar form, De Moivre's theorem, and cube roots of unity.

formulas.title: Limits and Derivatives
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Concept of limits, continuity, and derivatives. Differentiation rules, chain rule, and applications.

formulas.title: Statistics
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Measures of central tendency and dispersion. Mean, median, mode, standard deviation, and variance.

formulas.title: Probability
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.formula: $P(A) = \frac{n(A)}{n(S)}$ and $P(A \cup B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A \cap B)$
formulas.description: Basic probability concepts, addition and multiplication theorems. Conditional probability and Bayes' theorem.

formulas.title: Introduction to Three Dimensional Geometry
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Coordinate system in 3D space. Distance formula, section formula, and direction cosines.

formulas.title: Linear Inequalities
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Solving linear inequalities in one and two variables. Graphical representation and feasible region.

formulas.title: Solution of Triangle
formulas.subject: Mathematics
formulas.description: Sine rule, cosine rule, projection formula. Area of triangle, m-n theorem, and Napoleon's theorem.

formulas.title: Some Basic Principles and Techniques (IUPAC Naming)
formulas.subject: Organic Chemistry
formulas.description: IUPAC naming conventions for organic compounds. Functional groups, prefixes, suffixes, and numbering rules.

formulas.title: Some Basic Principles and Techniques (GOC)
formulas.subject: Organic Chemistry
formulas.description: Electronic effects: inductive, resonance, hyperconjugation. Reaction mechanisms, carbocation stability, and nucleophiles.

formulas.title: Some Basic Principles and Techniques (Isomerism)
formulas.subject: Organic Chemistry
formulas.description: Types of isomerism: structural, geometrical, optical. Enantiomers, diastereomers, and chirality concepts.

formulas.title: Hydrocarbon
formulas.subject: Organic Chemistry
formulas.description: Alkanes, alkenes, alkynes: preparation, properties, reactions. Aromatic hydrocarbons and petroleum products.

formulas.title: Environmental Chemistry
formulas.subject: Organic Chemistry
formulas.description: Environmental pollution: air, water, soil. Green chemistry, ozone depletion, greenhouse effect, and acid rain.
